page.title: 07BRAYDON GEOLOGY, PASTURE
page.content: This whole area is within the Braydon Forest area of "high ecological value", as in the 1983 Draft of Wiltshire Landscape Plan. (Wiltshire County Council). Geology - mainly Oxford Clay with small areas of undifferentiated Glacial Drift. Vegetation/Habitats-mixture of woodland & pasture with little arable and a few streams. Pasture-not yet surveyed by Conserv ationists, but probably a mixture of hay, silage and permanent pasture which has been agriculturally improved Some unimproved, neutral grassland may still exist, probably of a slightly acidic type. The wild flowers Betony and Meadow Thistle grow in such areas. Hedges-likely to be species-rich. Streams-ecological value unknown but good flora on edges.
